team6.finalproject

Class LightPoller

  • java.lang.Object
    • team6.finalproject.PausableTimerListener
      • team6.finalproject.LightPoller

  • public class LightPoller
extends PausableTimerListener
    Class that periodically polls a color sensor's SampleProvider to fetch brightness values. Uses the color sensor's RedMode readings to determine the brightness of a surface. These readings are normalized from 0 to 1, where 0 is black and 1 is white. The class multiplies these readings by 100 to get more readable int values. Can also interpret sudden drops in light readings as passing over a black line in the grid.
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Myriam Ayad, Andrei Ungur

    • Method Detail

      • timedOut

        public void timedOut()
        Refreshes the light sensor data every Timer loop.

      • blackLine

        public static boolean blackLine()
        Returns a boolean indicating if we are currently crossing a black line by comparing the previous light sensor reading to the current one. If there is a very significant drop in the readings, then we know we have passed over a black line.
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating if the robot has crossed a black grid line or not.

      • getReading

        public static float getReading()
        Fetches the current light sensor reading.
        Returns:
        a float representing the light sensor reading.
